Automated annotations are easy to produce in large amounts, and they allow us to derive realistic distributions of speech. For a constant annotation budget of 20 minutes per recording, we estimated the total amount of speech for each recording using only annotations extracted with two sampling strategies - random clips vs periodic (i.e. evenly spaced) clips - and different lengths of clips.
